caption:
Why isn’t it enough to test your TSH levels?

When it comes to your thyroid, conventional medicine practices usually start with your TSH levels. TSH is a hormone produced in the brain that tells the thyroid gland to make more T3 and T4 thyroid hormones in response to environmental factors. It is important to know your TSH levels, however, TSH isn’t enough to determine the status of your overall thyroid health.

Functional medicine providers, like Parsley Health, offer a more comprehensive panel of tests to get to the root cause of thyroid issues. By covering a wider breadth of hormones, clinicians are able to spot unusual ranges—and note any changes.

Lab tests are one of the most important tools in your prevention kit. Essential tests also reveal inflammatory markers and deficiencies in key nutrients like Vitamin D.

Head to our link in bio to learn even more about thyroid health.
